data.title: films – Terafty
data.meta_description: Posts about films written by Sesam Rana Magar and Terafty
data.text:
Written By Sesam Rana Magar, Terafty Manager. The images are sourced from social media accounts of the mentioned cafes and Pinterest. In a world where modern life feels like an endless competition and stress levels are ever on the rise, innovative solutions for mental healing are more significant than ever. These solutions go beyond traditional... Continue Reading →

The purpose of this article is to shed light on the reasoning behind our adaptation efforts for Your Voice, the winner of the 1st Terafty Korean Short Film Scenario Contest. To begin with, part of the reason we chose Your Voice as the winner of the 1st edition of our contest and therefore for a... Continue Reading →

After the successful outcome of the 1st Scenario Contest, we're excited to commence the 2nd contest. The winner of the 1st scenario contest, "Your Voice," is now in the production phase and will be released on our platform in late December this year or early January next year. Check out the details of the film... Continue Reading →

Once the preserve of music stages and fan meetings, Korean boy band members, known more colloquially as 'idols', are now increasingly making waves on the big and small screens. With charisma and talent that transcends music, these idols have been stepping out of their comfort zones to take on challenging roles, enriching the Korean entertainment... Continue Reading →

Introducing the 2023 Korea-Inspired Short Film Scenario Contest! Join us on an exhilarating journey into the captivating world of Korea through the lens of storytelling. Whether you're an aspiring storyteller or an experienced writer, this contest offers a remarkable opportunity to showcase your talent and bring your vision to life on the silver screen. At... Continue Reading →

Winners announced at 24th Jeonju International Film Festival awards ceremony. Credit: Yonhap The Jeonju International Film Festival's 24th edition concluded with an awards ceremony at the Samsung Cultural Center of Jeonbuk National University in North Jeolla Province on Wednesday. The event recognized winners across four categories, namely the international competition, Korean competition, Korean competition for... Continue Reading →

A trend that has emerged in the Korean entertainment industry is adapting popular webtoons, digital comics published online, into TV series and movies. Webtoons offer a unique storytelling style and compelling characters, making them a popular source material for Korean filmmakers. In this article, we will delve into some of the most popular Korean dramas... Continue Reading →

Photo by Tima Miroshnichenko on Pexels.com Despite being one of the world's largest movie markets pre-pandemic, the South Korean cinema box office plunged to its lowest level this year over the weekend, raking in a measly $6 million. The lineup of the highest-grossing movies remained stagnant from the previous week, with "John Wick: Chapter 4,"... Continue Reading →

In the latest weekend box office report from South Korea, "John Wick: Chapter 4" has emerged as the clear winner, outpacing the Japanese animation film "Suzume" to claim the top spot. According to data from the Korean Film Council's tracking service, Kobis, "John Wick 4" earned an impressive $4.05 million between Friday and Sunday, which... Continue Reading →

Korean cinema has long been renowned for its ability to deliver emotionally charged and visually striking films, and the romance genre is no exception. From heart-wrenching love stories to uplifting tales of second chances, Korean filmmakers have produced some of the most engaging and moving romance films in modern cinema. In this post, we present... Continue Reading →
